website_summaries.verdict: An attractive, streamlined smartwatch that has some new features and some known frustrations.
pros: A Fitbit watch that features a slim, lightweight design
In addition to fitness tracking, offers Fitbit OS with access to numerous apps
cons: Watch strap is a bit flimsy

customer_reviews.title: ... this for a week now and can’t say enough good things about it
customer_reviews.text: Have owned this for a week now and can’t say enough good things about it. Fantastic smart watch that is about 80% of an Apple Watch for less than half the price. If you love the Fitbit community and want a waterproof tracker that adds a ton of smart watch features and has great battery like to boot, this is your Fitbit!
customer_reviews.author: Steve Moose

customer_reviews.title: 2nd one and neither last longer than 6 months
customer_reviews.text: The first one I got I NEVER took off since it said it was water proof and could be used for swimming. It ended up with water damage in less than a year. Got a second one and I was super careful with it... 7 months later I get a couple lines in my screen and within a day the whole screen is streaks and then just dies. :-( I love all the tracking and everything about the watch when it is working but very sad I have dropped so much money on 2 that have died so quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Joel and Carissa

customer_reviews.title: 69 year young female loves this smart watch
customer_reviews.text: Love this smart watch! Wearing it for about 4 months with no issues. Charge it about every 4 days. Used swimming mode a number of times. Use workout mode 5 days a week. Walk every day and watch senses I am walking. Had charger 2 for about three years before this water resistant version came out. Recommend both.
customer_reviews.author: Gail E Hallock

customer_reviews.title: Did Not Last Long
customer_reviews.text: I have had three Fitbits before this one, the other three still work after years of use but this one stopped working in a matter of months. After two months the screen would start to fade if on for more than a few seconds, and now the heart rate doesn’t work at all. This was definitely a waste of money for me. I am going back to using my Alta HR, since I didn’t have any problems with that.
customer_reviews.author: Kailey

customer_reviews.title: Recommended for: Regular people who want to take care ...
customer_reviews.text: Recommended for: Regular people who want to take care of there health in a budget-friendly way! Pros: * Price - Just too good as compared to other ill thought products such as Android Wear. * It's for regular users who want fitness checks, limited smart-watch functions, great experience(battery life). * UI is simple, the design is simple. * Battery does last for 4 days. Cons: * Not for a fitness freak as it lacks GPS. * It's not as good smartwatch as Apple Watch but hey it's not as pricey as Apple watch.
customer_reviews.author: Anand

customer_reviews.title: Fitbit warranty is worthless
customer_reviews.text: The crystal on my Fitbit Versa underwent what appears to be a stress fracture as shown in the photo within a couple of months after I purchased it. I contacted Fitbit and after sending a picture of the damage was promptly told that it would not be covered by the warranty. What's more, according to a plethora of complaints online about similar experiences with Fitbit, they do not have spare parts or a repair service. This is ridiculous for a $200 product. I will never purchase from them again.
customer_reviews.author: Robert W. Wallace

customer_reviews.title: It won't stay connected
customer_reviews.text: the watch has to be connected to your phone via bluetooth in order to accurately measure distance. however, it refuses to sync most of the time despite supposedly being connected. the only way i found to get it to start working is to un-pair all bluetooth devices, re-pair the watch, and keep all other bluetooth devices disconnected. the heart rate monitor appears to work well. the step counter is way off and easily fooled...washing dishes gets me several thousand steps. using the watch to measure distance without a phone is pointless. i have a usual 5.5 mile route which the watch told me was 4.2 miles.
customer_reviews.author: corey s.

customer_reviews.title: It doesn’t serve basic purpose (Pedometer) of a fitness tracker
customer_reviews.text: Fitbit Versa *** MISERABLY FAILED as a pedometer which is BASIC FUNCTION *** of any fitness device on this earth. It counts mystery steps way more than you walk and it spoils the basic purpose of a fitness tracker. It’s been quite sometime and many people complained about it and Fitbit was unable to fix the issue and the Fitbit reps claim it is working as designed. It counts steps even when it is docked to charging station which is the worst part. Fitbit reps ask lame questions to each and everyone who complains about the issue. I gave 1 star for the sleek design and light weight. Please don’t buy it if you want to track your fitness accurately.
customer_reviews.author: Mahas

customer_reviews.title: Bad sync, bad measuring steps...poor service, terrible software.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this on another site to track gettjng back in shape. Steps are terrinbly inaccurate. I get up and walk around the house getting ready for my walk and jt puts up over 1000 steps!!! Ridiculous. Also sync is terrible. I jave jt linked to my fitness pal and it is constantly going off line. When I try to resync it. No amount of fiddling with it gets it to go back. Poor quality, bad software, non responsive. Beginning to hate it.
customer_reviews.author: MCOM Corp

customer_reviews.title: Fitbit Versa giving me a fit!
customer_reviews.text: Was a struggle to get set up because it couldn't be found by the app on Windows10 even though I shut off the firewall, bluetooth and ensured both were using the same router. Went to extreme of using a wifi hotspot where I could monitor connections to get it updated. Downloading music was likewise frustrating and took hours. Then discovery that it can't play music thru bluetooth and track biking at the same time. Next the discovery that it stops monitoring sleep if I wake up and go to use the toilet which is the thing that I stuck with Fitbit when my Charge died.
customer_reviews.author: Dáithí

customer_reviews.title: It is accurate +/- a few beats
customer_reviews.text: My main concern was how accurate this is as far as heart rates go. Luckily I have access to heart rate monitors and was able to compare. I’ve posted a video/ picture. Now this is my heart rate after moderate amount of activity. Have not tested accuracy during exercise.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Pairing for listening to music
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Versa fitbit for the sole purpose of being able to listen to music. I've purchased two different blue tooth listening buds and they won't pair with the Versa. I am so disappointed. The listening earphones work just fine with my phone so they are not the problem. I had one set paired and was able to use them twice to listen to music as I worked out. Now it won't work. My other fitbit was working just fine to track all of the other things and I just wanted the versa to be able to listen to music without having to carry my phone!
customer_reviews.author: Gina M. Cano

customer_reviews.title: Terrible device
customer_reviews.text: This device has been nothing but undue stress since it was received. It constantly disconnects from the app and needs to be paired often. The tracking is highly inaccurate and inconsistent. Now it won’t sync or pair to a device at all. Worst tracker we’ve ever owned. My two year old Blaze is still holding strong. Sad they replaced it with this garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Jesica whitney

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and user friendly
customer_reviews.text: Does everything as promised. Easy to set up and user friendly. Very comfortable to wear, I bought this model as I swim a lot and it’s water resistant. I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Smith

customer_reviews.title: $200 piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: Spent HOURS trying to connect this thing to my wifi- absolutely no luck. Somehow eventually the prompt came up to update the watch via Bluetooth. Okay, so I did. Took forever but it worked. I figured with the new firmware installed, the internet connectivity issue would disappear. NOPE. Put it back in its box and am returning this POS product. Typically I wouldn't be so harsh but I had the same issue with Fitbit's ARIA scale. I'm done with Fitbit. Excellent step counters but apparently their engineers can't figure out networking. Avoid at all costs.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Alam

customer_reviews.title: I shared earlier that I was having a hard time getting a replacement
customer_reviews.text: I shared earlier that I was having a hard time getting a replacement watch because it fractured But they have come through and honored their guarantee. So I am following up with this five stars. I love the watch and now I love the commitment to follow through with the guarantee
customer_reviews.author: Vince700

customer_reviews.title: Not the product for the cost
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this watch in earlier this year. The main reason I bought this device was for the supposed battery life. When I first purchased it the battery last 5-7 days. It now only last two days. I haven’t added any apps and have the same routine. This is my second watch in this line and the issue seems to be the same. I’d say it’s worth spending a little extra to have a watch that’s reliable for long than a few months. The hassle trying to get this issue resolved with Fitbit isn’t worth it! Hoping for better watches in the future backed by warranties that thing of us users!
customer_reviews.author: Mama-to-a-Gem

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely worth buying!!!
customer_reviews.text: Best Fitbit watch I’ve ever had. It’s so much better than the blaze (which was the last watch I had). I love that it is waterproof up until 50 meters. Can’t wait to wear it while swimming. I love the brighter screen and the wrist band is so much more comfortable than the one that came on the Fitbit. No need to change immediately unless you’re looking for metal or leather wrist band. I have found no cons yet since I received it on Tuesday April 17th. I love that there are apps on this watch and more to come.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla B.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Did quite make it 2 months before the screen went out. Worked fine last night when it was placed on the charger, but had lines in it when it was removed this morning. The watch worked perfectly up to this point. The wife actually preferred wearing it over her Gear S2 3g.
customer_reviews.author: Walter Sr

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, the charger is also great
customer_reviews.text: Great quality, the charger is also great . Very sensitive and has a lot of beautiful background . I would highly recommend to whoever is trying to lose weight, keep remind me how many steps are left and also notice you every day that you have to drink water more and more . Price sounds a little higher than usual but it worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Nasim Sabah

customer_reviews.title: Bad Battery
customer_reviews.text: When I first got the fitbit versa the battery lasted for about 3 days. Two and a half months later it will only last a single day from a FULL charge. I got the versa specifically because it boasted a 4+ day battery life while having the features I wanted. I contacted the seller, if I get a replacement I'll update this review until then the watch is pretty much useless.
customer_reviews.author: WL3025

customer_reviews.title: Garbage!!!
customer_reviews.text: So disappointed, I bought this for my boyfriend with very high expectations, we never got it to work, it was impossible to get it to receive notifications, further more, it counted 421 steps when it was on the table the whole day. The company is aware of all issues, and seems like they don't care. The only thing that works is the time, but who wants a fitbit just to give you the time? This is the dumbest watch among samart watches.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Battery (red light) on back of watch will not go off.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this watch since July, 2018. After only 3+ months the battery drains within 6-8 hours and shuts off. I did a factory shut down a few times but the light never goes off until it dies. I don't see any warranty information but you would think after paying $200 it would have some kind of warranty. I did love this watch and bought a few bands and a protective glass for the front. Spent a lot of money for something that is practically useless. I don't see anywhere on this website to contact customer service. Save your money!!!!
customer_reviews.author: C. Champlain

customer_reviews.title: All in all Good!
customer_reviews.text: I have used Fitbit for years and have upgraded over a couple of different kinds. I really do like the Versa. I was highly annoyed with the band attachment at first, but have gotten used to it. When I did have issues with mine after about 13 months or so, they were incredibly helpful and replaced it even though the warranty was technically up. The stellar customer service keeps me coming back!
customer_reviews.author: Ronda L Cauffman

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as the Blaze
customer_reviews.text: This sucks at differentiating between step tracking and riding my motorcycle. Brought it up in the forums and got lame responses from support. Went on a ride and racked up 10,000+ steps out of 14,000 during the ride and they said you will get “a few”. Still have not gotten any sleep tracking. Way disappointed compared to my Fitbit Blaze.
customer_reviews.author: D. McQuestion

customer_reviews.title: Terrible support
customer_reviews.text: The Special Edition fitbit pay bank list is misleading. While it says that Wells Fargo is supported, it only supports Visa Wells Fargo cards and Fitbit support says they cannot update their own supported bank list. They told me to go post about this problem on Fitbit's communist forum and low and behold people are complaining about the same problem there for months with no resolution in sight. Bad support.
customer_reviews.author: gamja3605

customer_reviews.title: Solid purchase
customer_reviews.text: I personally tried another smart watch before I got the Versa because I wanted to see if I could get something cheaper. When it all boils down I just Really like the way Fitbit makes their stuff and that fitness tracking is the top priority. I love How I can Easily start tracking my bike rides with a few pushes of a button. Before I would Have to go into a total separate bike app and go through all of these channels to finally get to tracking and now with my versa it automatically tracks it. Very pleased with my purchase. Worth the money in my opinion. I also love the clock face called “Nothing special” kudos to that creater!
customer_reviews.author: Crazycatlady

customer_reviews.title: So far I love it. I got it when it came out ...
customer_reviews.text: So far I love it. I got it when it came out 5 days ago. The battery was at 90%. Its Friday and its at 39%. I love the fact that it looks more like a watch then a tracker.
customer_reviews.author: Anya Tracey

customer_reviews.title: Fitbit Versa & Pixel XL 2
customer_reviews.text: Fitbit Versa nice device but no native support for newer phones. Cons - Fitbit Versa did not work out of the box spent countless hours troubleshooting before being forced to return the defective item. - No native support for latest Google Flagship phone ie Pixel 2 & Pixel XL 2 - No support from Fitbit -Notification laggy and not working Pros- Able to return for a replacement device -Once replacement device arrived was able to pair the device and update the firmware.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. This one stays on my wrist
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. This one stays on my wrist, I lost a few of the older cheaper ones. Glad to have stair count, my personal motivator was absent in the last Fitbit I had.
customer_reviews.author: Russell S. Randall

customer_reviews.title: Freaking mess(updated)
customer_reviews.text: Received this product yesterday and I spent literally 10 freaking hours trying to connect it to my phone and the internet. It would connect for about a minute and then the status of it won't start looping from connected to not connected. When it finally connected it would start updating and then disconnect again. If I cant get it to work today I'm defiantly sending this frustrating piece of crap back. UPDATED REVIEW!!!!! I finally ended up getting this product to work. It took forever to figure it out but once I got it figured out this product was great. I don’t use it as much as I should but it gets some time to get use to it.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly J

customer_reviews.title: Versa
customer_reviews.text: I love my Versa, I swim with it daily and shower with it on. No problems what so ever, it is good for 50 meters in the water, much deeper than I will every go! I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Beverlee Cholewa

customer_reviews.title: Great exercise watch
customer_reviews.text: I love this watch! I love it keeping track of sleep, step, calories, exercises, etc. it’s very insightful. It tells me to keep moving or that I’ve done a great job. It tells me when I reach goals. The weird thing is that it has auto workout recognition which is absolutely wonderful. It will detect when I haven’t actually done an exercise. I’ll have to go and delete that exercise on my log. It said I went swimming and told me I did a great job when in fact I haven’t yet put it in water. That’s more me because I feel paranoid about it. That is my only complaint about it. I love how long the battery lasts.
customer_reviews.author: goht

customer_reviews.title: Best fitbit tracker and smartwatch yet!
customer_reviews.text: Really nice watch! I like the look of it very smooth and keeps track of distance really well, better than Samsung galaxy gear 3 and better than Fitbit Blaze both watches I have owned before this.
customer_reviews.author: Erik N.

customer_reviews.title: Bands are too difficult to replace. Not for fashionable women.
customer_reviews.text: BecauseI like to change out my watch bands to fit my outfits this watch is not for me. I dont think the makers put much effort in what women would like in a watch that you wear daily. This is a daily wear watch so it should be versatile it is NOT. The process is very difficult and time consuming. The features dont very much from the ionic. The ionic cost more and is bulkier in size. However ease and versatility may be worth the price. I'm stuck with this watch that I have had for less than a month because I have scratched up the back trying to remove bands. However lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: CGB

customer_reviews.title: Spend the extra n get a Garmin
customer_reviews.text: Went through 2 of these in 12 months n 3 days. First one, the screen went out. Fitbit sent a replacement since it was under warranty. Second, battery went out 3 days past 1yr warranty. Fitbit could’nt help me. Junk watches don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: James C Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Screen Glitching
customer_reviews.text: The first 3 months of use went great. Then around December 2018 after a system update completed I started having display issues. Either the screen would not appear or it was covered with several lines. After some time the screen came back and at that time I shut it down to "reboot". This seemed to help however, the screen glitches are becoming more frequent and lasting longer. The buttons seem to still be operating as the unit vibrates but nothing is being displayed or several lines running vertically run through it. Now I am trying to use the 1 year warranty to get a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fitbit doesn’t back their products
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased for my birthday in May 2018 and in May of 2019 the display stopped working I’ve always had Fitbit products and the customer service was great. I recommended Fitbit to everyone that asked and I work in the fitness industry. My husband bought the versa for me so I could wear it when I taught my water exercise classes. I contacted the company and after a lot of emails , they will not replace my versa even though in one if their emails they said that they have heard from other customers that they have had the same problem. It was tracking my steps, vibrating for texts or calls but no display. So disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Dave G

customer_reviews.title: The bands are poorly designed and almost impossible to change
customer_reviews.text: Ok, Full disclosure I am as bit fitbit fan. Received a new Versa and attempted to change the band only to find it to be almost impossible! I called customer service and they told me the get few complaints about changing the bands- but if you do a search the internet is full of complaints about changing the bands. It has been 3 days and now i have scratched the back of it and likely cant return it. I am sure the device is fine as long as you do not try to change a band. If your not frustrated easy buy it! if you are pass on it!
customer_reviews.author: Harold Wood

customer_reviews.title: Great Workout app and costs much less than the Apple watch
customer_reviews.text: I love my Versa! My only negative is that I can’t get iTunes with it, but that’s more to do with my WiFi than with the watch. I do the walk/run training and this watches has an interval timing app which is a huge factor for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jazzy Girl

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Didn't like this. First off trying to switch bands is damn near impossible, trying to adjust band and take watch off or put on is such a hasdle due to damn tab under band, the waych itself does not accurately measure steps, most stuff on phone was useless to me and no fun. I just might as well get a pedometer. Boring, useless watch. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Fragile
customer_reviews.text: Worst tracker I have ever owned. Extraordinarily fragile. Cracked a corner of the screen not even knowing how, didn’t drop drop it or wipeout while wearing it. Called Fitbit and was told cosmetic damage not covered by warranty. Not even a month later the software locks up on the Fitbit logo display screen and won’t reset. Called Fitbit again and after a week of waiting to hear back I called them and was told the unrelated crack of the screen corner was the cause of the software problem and was not covered by warranty. So what exactly is this warranty for? I’ll be purchasing a Garmin.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin G. Seals

customer_reviews.title: Worst purchase I have ever made!
customer_reviews.text: I have had nothing but problems with this watch. It constantly gets stuck on the logo screen and has to be reset. Now it is permanently stuck on the logo screen - won,t reset no matter what I try. I called customer service and they could not help me. Super frustrating. DO NOT PURCHASE this product!!!
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Intuitive and thorough
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my mom on Christmas this year and she treated it like another baby for about a month. Then she put it through some tests and found out just how durable it is. She's enjoyed looking at her sleep patterns every morning and is happy with the pedometer. It has everything she needs (including style!) and for a lower price than the Apple watch. For her not being super tech savvy, the app and watch are very user friendly. I would get this for an older parent or anyone who's more active than needing to get their apple fix
customer_reviews.author: Tzwol

customer_reviews.title: Better Then Apple Watch
customer_reviews.text: Its okay for now but it just came out last month imma just give time for better apps but its better then the apple watch ⌚️ in i had my watch on for 4 days now in its only on 39% apple watch last about 24 hours 😂
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Avoid at all costs
customer_reviews.text: Avoid this at all costs. My Versa stopped working 3 months after purchase and the customer service was beyond poor. I explained to the rep, John Z, that my Versa no longer recorded my heart rate or sleep. He said that it “wasn’t that it didn’t work...” my response, of course, is that a heart rate and sleep monitor that didn’t do either of those things is...I’m not sure. No recourse. No assistance. I’ve purchased several Fitbits for myself and family members. Never again.
customer_reviews.author: Okay

customer_reviews.title: Awful defective product DON'T BUY
customer_reviews.text: Bought the Fitbit Versa from Amazon on 08/29/18 and on 03/11/19, it suddenly stopped working despite 100% charge and the screen has been blank since then. Several attempts to reset and factory resets were to no avail. Trying to get customer support through Fitbit to no avail There is supposed to be a year warranty coverage. A search online shows that this is a very common problem making the Fitbit VERS a very defective product. So DON'T BUY.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Fitbit not working
customer_reviews.text: I purchased my Fitbit in August and received delivery mid September. From the very beginning I have been inundated with problems. The watch itself is beautiful, however the problems are numerous. 1. Unable to sync. 2. Unable to change clock faces. 3. Screen freezes. 4. Does not charge. 5. Now the watch has completely switched off and the screen is blank. I cannot do anything with it. Please assist with the above problems. I did not have any problems with the Fitbit Surge. I await your feedback.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Best smartwatch I've had to date and best fitbit I've ...
customer_reviews.text: Best smartwatch I've had to date and best fitbit I've had. I think it does most smart watch and fitness band functions well. Especially when you consider the price point. Battery life is great. I usually get 3-4 days out of it. Adding music is a real pain but I usually use my phone for that anyway. I think a lot of the shortcomings that people complain about will be fixed with software updates. I think Fitbit finally has a smart watch that compliments their excellent fitness app.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas B.

customer_reviews.title: Stopped connecting
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: I tried over and over until I was finally able to reconnect my versa to my phone. Maybe it was a phone problem... My versa is updating normally now. Whew! My versa works great at first. I didn't have the issues I read about here on Amazon. However, a month and a half in, my versa stopped connecting and updating tonthe app properly. I've tried restarting and resetting and now it won't connect at all. My return window ended mid June so I'm extremely disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: 3speed

customer_reviews.title: Only worked 31 days
customer_reviews.text: Fitbit Versa was great for 31 days. Now face won’t display and I’m past 30 day return window. Very upsetting.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: taking abuse like a champ
customer_reviews.text: bought this with the my yearly fitness reimbursement I get from my company so this free to me Versa has taken a guilt free beating and stood up to being dunked, dusted, banged around, spray painted, dropped, and generally abused the way I abuse my hands. Its still going strong with out showing scratches. My battery lasts about 3.5 to 4 days. My only complaint is that the read out that comes as a default is crappy and you have to pay money for third party faces that make use of the Versa's built in features. happily no more than the cost of a downloadable song but for the price the screen should be something you can customize yourself
customer_reviews.author: ErinF

customer_reviews.title: This watch does most of what I want it to do
customer_reviews.text: What I like most about this watch is that it does most of what I want it to do without a lot of difficulties. I was hoping they would work with Medtronic to send my Glucose numbers with the watch, but you can't get everything I guess. I'm not sure its goal setting is appropriate for someone who is working through a serious illness, but in time I hope I will be able to achieve its goals. I really like the heart monitor, step counter, weather, and music features and most of all Pandora. I researched watches for hours before I finally purchased one and that made a difference.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Ross

customer_reviews.title: Will not stay connected
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this so much. It's a beautiful watch, and the screen is perfect. But it won't stay connected and won't sync. This completely defeats the purpose of having a smart watch. I've tried every trick I've seen and for months I continue to have this problem with my Samsung Galaxy note 8. I bought this shortly after release. I've been a loyal Fitbit customer since 2011/2012, and this is my 4th Fitbit, and likely my last. I kept hoping that the sync issues would resolve after release, but they just haven't. Sorry Fitbit, it's been a good run, but I'm going to get a Samsung watch at some point instead.
customer_reviews.author: R. Hanson

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to stay connected to phone
customer_reviews.text: This versa continuously drops the bluetooth connection with my phone. I've done everything mentioned on the fitbit commuity site for troubleshooting and it still disconnects. I tried to connect with the fitbit support # amazon asks you to try before you return it and they were of NO help AT ALL!!! It seems this fitbit absolutely needs to be the only device your phone is paired with. If you have anything else paired with your phone the watch will shutoff it's bluetooth connection. Too much frustration to try and get something to work that isn't that accurate to begin with.
customer_reviews.author: Tucsonian

customer_reviews.title: After using it for two years I say with great certainty the Versa is not worth owning
customer_reviews.text: Fitbit wanted to build an electronic pedometer. It evolved into an over-complicated device with an excess of "features" you don't really want, but are obliged to have owing to the constant upgrades to the software. It tries to link you in with all your idiot friends and offers tiny little videos for "training" and "coaching." All these use up the battery and causes lots of latency problems with updates. The sticky rubber band makes putting it on and off a struggle. And really, you're going to have to charge it everyday. I do not recommend this product and hope I can sell it to some gullible fool on ebay.
customer_reviews.author: bookmanswake

customer_reviews.title: So comfortable !
customer_reviews.text: I am enjoying my new Fitbit Versa Smartwatch. It feels so comfortable on my wrist; it is lighter than my others two models (HR & HR 2) that I had before. The battery life is very long and all the features are amazing. I love that I can download free apps according to my taste and necessities. I bought the black Fitbit Versa and an extra silver stylish band to use occasionally. The only thing that I didn’t like is how hard is to put back a new band; it is tricky and took me some time, but even though, I decided to give 5 stars because overall, this product is great.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle CustomOer  Ofelia C Alvarez

customer_reviews.title: Absolute junk!
customer_reviews.text: This was my 2nd Fitbit, I am completely unsatisfied with their products and their customer service. Both Fitbits only lasted just over 1 year, making the warranty expired. I refuse to spend any more money on this junk when other brands are out there. Until they can create a better quality product or extend their warranty, I will look at Garmin or other fitness tracking products
customer_reviews.author: Donna & Mikka

customer_reviews.title: Was initially disappointed on the battery life
customer_reviews.text: Big improvement since the firmware update just 2 days ago. Was initially disappointed on the battery life. Was only getting between 1 - 2 days per charge. Battery going strong now, only down 19% in 38 hours. On target to beat 4 days easy! Also had an issue where the HR was not displaying properly during exercise and was different than what was shown on the Fitbit app. That is hopefully fixed as well. If so, this review may just go up to 5 stars. The watch is light and easy to use which is a welcome change from my Asus Zen Watch 2.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Only worked for 6 months.
customer_reviews.text: Everything was pretty okay for 6 months, now it suddenly won't charge or link to my phone. Don't waste your money, Go directly to fit bit and purchase one. These are either defective or refurbished trash. I purchased in mid January right when all this COVID started making major headlines. Only wore the device around the house during quarantine, never got it wet, never dropped it, always charged it fully. And from other reviews, I'm not the only one who has experienced this. Just save yourself some extra coins by going to the direct site..... You'll at least get a yr warranty.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to Apple Watch!
customer_reviews.text: Great alternative to the Apple Watch (which is WAY too expensive) and it’s also upgrade to my FitBit Charge 2. It seems more reliable than the Charge 2 for catching Heart Rate and pleased with this especially with the Black Friday discounts from the vendor that were available from Amazon! I got my wife a Rose Gold one which was on back order at the FitBit website and I got myself a black Versa also! I just wish the batter lasted 7 days like the Charge 2. I’ll play with the autowake and notification settings to prevent the screen from lighting up and buzzing all the time and maybe that will save some battery.
customer_reviews.author: Jim R.

customer_reviews.title: Great watch for notifications
customer_reviews.text: This is my first Fitbit watch and smart watch. I’ve have bought them for many people so I needed one for myself. This watch does the job and is great for fitness people. You can change the themes on your interface so you don’t need to stick to one look. The OS does seem a bit outdated but it’s not bad. As far as it working on my phone for notifications, I love it. I tend to look at my watch first before my phone for messages and any alerts. That’s what I love about this watch the most.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos J. Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable, poor customer service
customer_reviews.text: This was my third fitbit in 5 years and by far, the worst. As a watch it's useless. Shaking or twisting my wrist does not show the time; only pressing the single, left button displays the time. Sleep tracking is a hit or miss. For days it will not show readings on my fitbit app ; then, suddenly with no effort on my part, the readings for the last 3-9 nights will display on the fitbit app! Bah humbug. I've had several days of itchy, red rash on my wrist from the band. If you need condescending customer service, this may be your cup of tea? Not for me.
customer_reviews.author: LSvach

customer_reviews.title: App is terrible
customer_reviews.text: While the watch is working just fine the app is absolutely terrible. Does not stay connected to the watch (when I'm sitting right next to my phone). Trying to switch the clock face takes more time than it takes to read a bible- and then it says its 'having trouble syncing'..... which is awesome. I stand by Fitbit's products, but fix the app and make it useful please.
customer_reviews.author: Jillian

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gift
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my boyfriend for Christmas. He loves it! It’s just as good as an Apple Watch if not better, especially for those into fitness. The only thing it can’t do is answer calls or text reply with iPhone as of right now. But I love how you can read entire text messages with a finger swipe down compared to the Charge 3 that makes you wait as the text scrolls across and never the full message. He actually turned around and bought me one for Christmas too. I love it!!
customer_reviews.author: Ruth

customer_reviews.title: Battery life has never lasted more than 10 hours
customer_reviews.text: I got this back in September as a watch to use when I'm interning at physical therapy clinics (it's not polite to check phones when working with patients). Ever since September, I've never managed to get more than 10 hours of battery life even when I'm not wearing it. All day sync is off, the screen is set to turn only only manually, and I've tried just about everything that I can but to no avail. I'm not sure if I got a defective watch, but other than the battery life, the build quality is nice and the features are fine. But due to the battery life, I can't recommend this watch to anyone else.
customer_reviews.author: Derick Tom

customer_reviews.title: and i love that!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't want to get addicted to this thing, but it happened.... I preach about having "off line" time, yet I now have this piece which reminds me about messages and work outs, etc... but you can set it to tell you what you want it to remind you about what you don't - and it plays my music !!!! and i love that!!!! I bought a wireless head set for it after figuring out how to download the music - took a bit of playing with it but I got it and I love it! no more wires, no more phones or ipods for work outs! the battery is pretty good too and the charge is FAST!
customer_reviews.author: Stella

customer_reviews.title: Get one, you won’t regret it!
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love it! I’ve had it for 5 days now and I don’t know how I lived without it. I enjoy all the features. As a woman, I was slightly concerned about how big it might be but it’s not at all too big. It actually feels better than my Charge 2 did, especially when I sleep with it on. It did take awhile to setup and to transfer music but I just made sure I had plenty of time when doing those things and I never felt inconvenienced.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin K.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Warranty
customer_reviews.text: Have has watch less than six months and now won't connect to phone and won't sync. too many hoops to jump through for warranty. DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: There is no repair in US
customer_reviews.text: I order this watch in May in August the watch fell from the chair onto the floor and the screen cracked. I called customer support to find a place to send the watch for a screen replacement and was informed there was no repair center in the US and I could not order a replacement screen. The customer service rep then proceeded to read their canned script on why the cracked screen was not covered by warranty even though I was not asking for warranty coverage. Too much to pay for a disposable watch. Look for another brand
customer_reviews.author: GL

customer_reviews.title: Fitbit fabuNOT
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love Fitbit, have had 4. This Versa I’ve had for 16 months, and I’ve had difficulty charging since received. I had to clean and adjust the charger each time, and now.... it won’t charge at all. I’ve tried everything to trouble shoot including different plugs, different outlets, cleaning the posts and the watchback... and now it just overheats (not to the touch), permanently black screen, and no use. So disappointed. I hate to change brands because I love the Fitbit app and the community, but this was disheartening.
customer_reviews.author: DePhi

customer_reviews.title: Longterm usage not great
customer_reviews.text: Less than 14 months after my husband spent $200 on my Versa, the heartrate doesn't properly track during my workouts. It goes in and out and even with adjusting the placement doesn't solve the problem. Because I'm less than 2 months outside of the warranty window, Fitbit has offered me a 25% discount on the purchase of another watch. That is nice but the same thing happened with my Charge 2 so spending another couple hundred for maybe a year-ish of usage doesn't sound like a good investment. I'm newly postpartum and just want to be able to accurately track my workouts!
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Garza

customer_reviews.title: Band change out deal breaker . . .
customer_reviews.text: Ridiculous! Tried to change out the band from S to L. Over an hour. My husband tried. Could get it “in” but not snapped/secured in place. Incredibly frustrating. Will not even attempt to add this to my Fitbit app yet. Have to go to watch repair store and pay and hope they can get new band fitted. I bought this to replace Blaze that died after being immersed in salt water kayaking. If watch repair can’t get new band on, this is going back! Versa isn’t cheap but the parts are! Will update after attempting to pay someone to install L band. Definitely leery of trying to change out for other color bands.
customer_reviews.author: J-GA

customer_reviews.title: ... bits in the last couple of years and I love my versa
customer_reviews.text: I've had several fit bits in the last couple of years and I love my versa! My main reason for buying it was for the waterproof capability of it. The Charge HR 2 was nice, just couldn't get wet. I'm an RN, a runner and I have a 7 yr old son whom loves to swim, so being able to get my fit bit wet is important.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Shouldn't be this difficult to connect.
customer_reviews.text: Would not connect. Used the Fitbit website help, still would not connect. Now after following Fitbit advice the watch is locked up, won't do anything. So 2 hours on the phone with Fitbit and 2 factory resets, rebooted the phone several times, every other Bluetooth device in the house turned off, the watch connected. From the start I followed the instructions on app. I had to use a second device to get it connected then move it to the original phone. Yes both devices are on the Fitbit approved list.
customer_reviews.author: matt

customer_reviews.title: Great everyday watch to track all you fitness and activity.
customer_reviews.text: I've wore a fit it for a couple years and this is my favorite one so far. I wore a blaze before I had this one and it feels like an upgrade from that. My only gripe about this watch is how stupid it is to remove the bands from it. I liked the blaze because I could take it apart from the band and slip it into my pocket easily at work since I do factory work and cannot wear a watch. You can still remove the bands but, it is kind of a pain to do so.
customer_reviews.author: The Dreadbug

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as previous Fitbit
customer_reviews.text: I had a prior Fitbit that was amazing. It could last for a week, was good at tracking my heart rate, and was generally really solid. It wasn’t waterproof though and I wanted to upgrade so I bought this Versa in August 2019. It’s already stopped working. The battery life has always been way worse than my older Fitbit. It seemed to always be running out of charge after just a day or so of continuous use. Also this one has just been super buggy. There’s always something a little off with it. I wouldn’t recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Tracey

customer_reviews.title: Great device.... hate band changing!!
customer_reviews.text: I really love my Fitbit!! Does everything I want it to.... Pro (for me): it is slimmer than other models out there and my biggest thing was seeing the whole text message, as I am a nurse and cannot be on my phone during clinic. But I am able to see what is going on when my 15 year old messages me ❤️ Con: I thought people we exaggerating when they said the band is difficult to get back on... if your not a astrophysicist you may have difficulties getting it on!! It is super frustrating and looks like I am just going to stay with what’s on here.
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine ☀️

customer_reviews.title: Prefer simplicity of versa over Apple, especially for price
customer_reviews.text: Love this watch. The Apple had more than what I needed, but I needed more than a simple Fitbit. The Versa is the perfect sweet spot. It is light on my wrist, easy to use, fairly intuitive, great for HR and step monitoring, and I can control my music. So happy I didn’t get the Apple. If you don’t need the extra bells and whistles of apps, texts, and calling from your watch, buy the versa!
customer_reviews.author: Leah Novak

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Only had for 3 days. Simple to set up.
customer_reviews.author: J. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great for busy folks with skinny wrists
customer_reviews.text: Bought the versa instead of the versa lite or versa 2. It is the older version but its much smaller - which I like for my skinny wrists. I just wanted to track steps, track sleep, reply to messages, and have music capabilities without being attached to my phone. With the new update, I can now easily swap between screen backgrounds (clock faces). 😉 Also, if you are an android user you can answer texts with predetermined replies. Very useful to say the least. Loving it!
customer_reviews.author: Dearangel199

customer_reviews.title: Better than the Apple Watch
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely amazing smart watch. The battery life is probably the best in the industry, I use it all the time to check the weather and my stats throughout the day and I still go 4-5 days between charges. Aesthetically, it rivals the smart watch and anything that Samsung or Garmin has to offer. Functionality is great as well, I've used the Starbucks app installed on it to pay and it works flawlessly. I love that you can cycle between so many different watch faces as well, all available through your smartphone at the press of a button! Kudos to Fitbit on this one, job well done!
customer_reviews.author: Joe Herrera

customer_reviews.title: the model I bought does not include nfc
customer_reviews.text: I honestly would have not bought it if I knew it did not come with nfc, I re-read the part about "special versa models" that sounded to me like the versas came with NFC, now I realized that there's a "different" version that comes with NFC. But when you buy the one without NFC since they're technically the same product, the reviews made it sound like it had NFC (because they bought the other model). That was the main reason to buy this watch, so I'm either just going to re-sell it to get some money back or have it collect dust and never buy from fitbit again :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Avoid fitbit, go with a garmin !  (Bad battery, non-durable watch screen)
customer_reviews.text: After using this smart watch for 8 months, I gave up on keeping a charged battery. During the first 2 months, the battery was able to keep a charge for a few days but then as time went on, the it required a daily charge to make it 24 hours. The final straw was a small drop (<4) onto a vinyl flooring with the result of a cracked screen. The only redeeming feature for this model is the sleep tracking is pretty decent. However, that is not strong function enough to persuade me to continue with fitbit. Overall, I find the Garmin far superior in battery life (>5-7 days) and durable to the drops.
customer_reviews.author: cny

customer_reviews.title: It was good when it worked...
customer_reviews.text: This was my first FitBit product or smart watch, and I was pretty happy with it when it worked. I was pleased with the tracking and heart rate monitor, but I've now had two glitch and then stop working out of nowhere. Both stopped within 9 months of having them. FitBit replaced it the first time, but now I'm outside of my original warranty so they won't do anything even though the replacement is only 8 months old. I'm not sure if other FitBit products are like this as far as randomly dying, but I would not recommend this for the price.
customer_reviews.author: M Colby

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing lack of Customer Support
customer_reviews.text: I was extremely disappointed in the FitBit Versa. When playing hockey, the touchscreen terminated the workout recording. I saw that many others had similar difficulties with the Versa. The change suggestion to allow a “disable touchscreen” option was marked as “not planned”. I called FitBit and the tech was very dismissive of my issue. This was the first FitBit product that I have been disappointed in. Unfortunately, with the dismissive attitude of FitBit support, I am questioning whether to buy any further products from them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great buy! Love this Fitbit Versa
customer_reviews.text: Great buy! Love this Fitbit Versa! Went from a Charge2 to the Versa after saving a drowning child fried my charge. I figured never a bad thing to go waterproof. The only con is the Bluetooth transmitter. It works fine playing music while working outside or walking, but when I run, I have to just use my phone because it can't keep up with the fast motion of my wrist. Not that big of an issue to subtract a star, because everything else makes this way worth the buy!!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Dawson

customer_reviews.title: Fit and functional
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable and functional! I love all the things I can do from my Fitbit! So happy with this purchase. Not too big or bulky either.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Loving this smartwatch.
customer_reviews.text: Loving this smartwatch. After getting used to a much larger watch than I normally wear, I am addicted. Looks quite stylish with a new band also. Integrates great with many other apps and the Fitbit app is very helpful feature wise. Easy to use. Great functionality and customizability.
customer_reviews.author: ARGTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Battery and unit died after 1 year.  Poor customer support
customer_reviews.text: Battery or unit would not charge after 1 year. Contacted Fitbit Customer Support, who could not help me without the email of the person I gave unit to as a gift. In my case my sister. Fitbit support only saw the older Fitbit unit (Charge) synching to the account and said everything was fine. Explained that we had to use older Fitbit, since newer Versa model stopped charging. Even purchased new charger to see if that was the issue. No CS supervisor available to help resolve our issue. Very poor customer support.
customer_reviews.author: Andre Nakaso

customer_reviews.title: Do not get this watch!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this watch now for a little under two years and within this time frame, the watch has been plagued with issues. I am currently on my second versa watch and it is on its way out. Both watches worked for approximately 9-10 months before they became essential useless. It will not keep the correct time, sleep monitoring has stopped working via heart beat, and will not sync even when forced. I have troubleshot this second watch on four different phones doing precisely the same exact steps to no avail. You are better off buying different model or purchasing a different smart watch that can be reliably used for longer that 9 months.
customer_reviews.author: Dierre Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Unable to complete initial setup
customer_reviews.text: I spent 4 hours on the first Versa that I ordered trying to complete setup. After getting a replacement I spent another 6 hours trying to get the Versa to do anything besides telling me to download the Fitbit app to complete setup. After contacting the manufacturer support via Twitter and web based chat and still not getting any further than the initial start up screen I have decided to return that Versa along with the additional warranty and screen protectors and cut my losses to save my sanity. I believe that the legacy devices are no longer supported by FItbit and I would recommend anyone to either by a newer device, or to steer clear of this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Just Perfect!!
customer_reviews.text: I love love my versa! Just perfect ! I like the selection of workouts and see st the end how many calories I lost time,heart rate and I’m amaze in the feature of counting your steps! Now I challenge myself daily to walk more, and burn more calories! LOVE ya Versa!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... to get used to but rather than that it’s awesome all the clock faces and the apps you can ...
customer_reviews.text: I wish the bands weren’t so hard to change out now and the way they changed the notifications takes a few times to get used to but rather than that it’s awesome all the clock faces and the apps you can have.
customer_reviews.author: Carson Burroughs

customer_reviews.title: A great replacement for my Pebble.
customer_reviews.text: The Fitbit Versa is a slick looking watch. Thin and black on clasic black. I am still getting used to the interface. Long battery life. I got notifications on phone and email when the battery hit 25% letting me know it was time to charge it. The fitness aspects are neumerous. I am able to link it to Google Fit with the Fit to Fit app. The interface is intuative, the icons large and clear. The app is excellent. I have a complaint when using the timer. I have neropathy and cannot feel the vibration. It would be so very helpful if the screen would turn on when the countdown timer reaches 0. I am very hppy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: FitBit Customer Service Blows
customer_reviews.text: Ok, bought it in Feb. Stopped working in June. Sent it to them in June and just today, 08/15/19 got a replacement sent to me. Had to fight and fight to get it. They asked for it back including the charger. Got nothing today but the fitbit. No band. No charger. I hate these people.
customer_reviews.author: cruz4dlord

customer_reviews.title: fell apart one day
customer_reviews.text: I had the watch for about one year and one day when I took my son the library I looked at my watch and the face came off. now the watch won't even come on. For a 200$ item i would expect better quality. Also there is no built in find my phone feature that is available on less expensive trackers. Last fitbit device.
customer_reviews.author: Rj C.

customer_reviews.title: Bad experience
customer_reviews.text: I really like the watch until I had issues after the five month apparently a bad display. call fitbit up and had no problems getting a replacement. Eigth months after that, the replacement went bad and i called them back...this time I was told it was out of it one year warranty for date of purchase and there was nothing he could do except give me 25% off another fitbit. You think I want to spend another $150 on a watch that lasts maybe 8 months...
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to like this product.
customer_reviews.text: On the whole this product wasn't bad. Did just about everything I wanted it to, aside from the vibrate feature not being very strong. My big issue is that it doesn't seem to last. I've been through 2 in just over a year. And FitBit's support is almost anything but. They make you jump though quite a lot of hoops, and don't seem to really listen. It also annoys me when companies make you register their product and make an account, that they kick out of the said account to ask for "support". If I can get this watch replaced again I will; but it will be a long time till I buy another Fitbit product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Questionable quality
customer_reviews.text: Delivery of this watch took several weeks, and once I received it, it worked for 3-4 days. After charging the watch for the first time, it failed to turn back on. Completely dead. After multiple emails and back and forths with the vendor, I'm working now to get a replacement watch. My confidence in the quality of this watch is LOW.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

product_meta.title: Fitbit Versa Smart Watch, Black/Black Aluminium, One Size (S & L Bands Included)
product_meta.description: Color:BlackLive your best life with the Fitbit Versa family of health and fitness smartwatches. The Versa Lite Edition includes core fitness and smart features like activity, sleep and heart rate tracking, notifications, apps and 4+ day battery life—plus bold color choices and an easy one button design. Fitbit Versa includes all the features of Lite Edition plus music, on screen workouts, floors climbed and swim lap tracking. Finally, the Versa Special Edition includes all the features of Versa, plus a special woven band and on the go payments with Fitbit Pay.
feature_bullets: Includes all Versa Lite Edition features plus: store and play 300 plus songs, utilize on screen workouts that play on your wrist and coach you through every move and track swim laps and floors climbed

Track your all day activity, 24/7 heart rate, & sleep stages, all with a 4 plus day battery life (varies with use and other factors), charge time (0 to 100 percent): two hours. Slim, comfortable design with a lightweight, anodized aluminum watch body

Use 15 plus exercise modes like run or swim (Fitbit versa is water resistant to 50 meters, we do not recommend wearing charge 3 in a hot tub or sauna.) To record workouts and connect to Smartphone GPS for more precise real time pace & distance
Access your favorite apps for sports, weather & more and get called, calendar, text, and app alerts. Syncing range - up to 30 feet
Get call, text, calendar and smartphone app notifications when your phone is nearby. Plus send quick replies on android only. Operating temperature 10 to 60 degrees celsius
Automatically track select sports & workouts with smarttrack and use female health tracking in the fitbit app to log periods, symptoms and more
Radio transceiver: bluetooth 4.0. Compatible with iphone, android & windows phones
